safety_flags.evidence: The phrase 'some of us are real' implies a contrast and potential pressure to conform to a particular viewpoint of authenticity.
safety_flags.benign_explanation: The author may simply be expressing a personal opinion about the perceived artificiality of a public figure and contrasting it with their own genuine experiences.

safety_flags.evidence: The inclusion of the date/time stamp '02/08/26(Sun)01:31:22 No.41934209' resembles data often automatically generated.
safety_flags.benign_explanation: This could be an automatically generated post ID from the platform the text originated from.

logical_fallacies.quote: its too bad biggie was basically a character and some of us are real
logical_fallacies.correction: This statement implies that Biggie, by being a 'character,' is not 'real' in the same way as the speaker. This sets up an arbitrary distinction to exclude Biggie from a group ('real' people) without providing a clear, objective criterion for exclusion.
